text.tspan: CS 251 Lecture May 25
PLA/ROM
- Can be thought of as 2^n m-bit words
- All min-terms are there
- "Read only memory" used in bootlader, etc.
Background on transistors
How did early computer sicentists (e.g. Charles Babbage)
store and manipulate bits?
- Vacuum tubes (slow)
Did we ever try other number systems? Tertiary, etc.?
Yeah, but it always came back to binary - it's just as fast, and
pretty simple.
Recall the design mantra, "keep the simple case fast".
Early transistors were pretty expensive
MOSFET - metal oxide semiconductor field effect transistors
Built from silicon (Si), 4 valence electrons in outer shell
Forms a strong crystal lattice
Doping the silicon makes it a semi-conductor
Different layers of n-type and p-type transistors.
NMOS vs. PMOS
Labelled with base/collector/emitter, or in this class, gate/source/drain
Usually concerned with what signal is coming at the base/gate
NPN vs PNP material - alternating p-type and n-type
Gate only controls the voltage flow
Recall the train diagram from last class
When the system is connected to ground, we will read off 0V as the
system current is being drained
If Q1 is connected, everything equals 0V. Call Q1 a resistance - high or low.
High resistance means low/no flow
If Q1 generates a high resistance, we have no current flow and we read off
a 1. With a low resistance, we become grounded, and we read off a 0.
The voltage applied at the gate determines whether we have high or low resistance.
If we assign an input value A to the gate, we can have high voltage (1) or low voltage (0).
Even though A and F aren't di
If A is a 0, your NMOS transistor will generate a high resistance
no flow in the substrate - gate becomes negatively charged, so P and both Ns are all negative and
no current flows.
NMOS/PMOS material changes +/-
NMOS transistor: opposite of gate charge
A Q1 F
0 high resistance 1
1 low resistance 0
PMOS transistor: same charge as gate
A Q1 F
0 high resistance 0
1 low resistance 1
We can't use just an NMOS or just a PMOS to store a bit.
NMOS is a "weak" 0, strong 1
PMOS is a "weak" 1, strong 0
high impedence still leaks some current - it's not a perfect low resistance
Couple them to form a CMOS "compliement MOS"
the strong value is read from each gate, so we have no doubt in our bit value
this is the basic unit of hardware utilizing transistors
"the one with the circle is nmos"
A Q1 Q2 F
0 l h 1
1 h l 0
So each input requires 2 transistors
e.g. 2-input NOR gate would cost us 4 transistors
CMOS NAND
Q1 and Q2 are NMOS
3 and 4 are PMOS
"The double connection to Vdd doesn't stack to a '2'
A B Q1 2 3 4 Z
0 0 L L H H 1 "The first row tells you everything you need to know"
0 1 L H H L 1 "Q3 and Q4 must both be low in order to let us reach ground and output a 0"
1 0 H L L H 1
1 1 H H L L 0

flowRoot.flowPara: When A is 0, an output "B" above Q1 would output:
